profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-03 14:11:44 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center. Researchers interested in accessing audiovisual recordings in this collection must use access copies. Contact References Services for more information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lars Speyer (1925-2007) was a photographer in Palo Alto, California.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Archives also holds a 1989 July 11 oral history interview with Carlos Villa conducted by Moira Roth, and a 1995 June 20-July 10 oral history interview with Villa conducted by Paul Karlstrom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A U-matic videocassette recording of Carlos Villa's performance art at his farm in San Francisco, California, recorded by Lars Speyer. The recording includes rhythmic music and still frames, incorporating bones and elements from the farm as Villa applies paint to his body and rolls on a paper canvas. A man dressed in feathers and zebra patterned cloth resides over the performance.

userestrict.head: Terms of Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.
